intro: Angelica wulsiniana, commonly known as the Chinese angelica, is a biennial or perennial plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is valued for its aromatic roots, which are used in traditional Chinese medicine. Angelica wulsiniana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
